website_summaries.verdict: Attractive, well-made, high-performance model good for a wide variety of outdoor sports, easily taking you from the water to the road, the boat to the beach, and more.
pros: Leather and fabric upper provides well-made durability and an attractive design
Vents for quick water drainage and delivers excellent traction on many surfaces
Whether you’re walking in cities, kayaking, hiking in the jungle or hitting several surfaces in one day, this is an ideal multipurpose shoe
Very sturdy all-purpose shoe designed for flexibility and grip across many surfaces
cons: Can run small and narrow, and the fit can cause blisters for some people
Stitching may come loose after only a few months
Sole can be too slippery for some surfaces/users

customer_reviews.title: Really fantastic shoes. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these for my week long canoe trip in the BWCA. These shoes exceeded my expectations: great in the water, good support, excellent traction, easy to shake the rocks and sand out while wearing, quick drying, protected my feet, and look awesome. What's not to love? I climbed rocks both wet and dry, swam, portaged, everything just fine in these shoes. The other guys on the trip were impressed and several mentioned wanting to purchase a pair of these shoes. I can't recommend them enough and plan to purchase another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Held up well for 3 days at the river. Runs a little big.
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear 11.5s though I can fit into 11s. I went with 11s on these so they weren’t too small, but they ended up a bit loose. Drop a half to whole size from your regular shoe size. I put them through some torture at the Frio River in the Texas hill country with significant amounts of wading in rocky waters which would destroyed most shoes I’ve tried before and these held up without a scratch. They were comfortable except they rubbed a little bit on my arches. Not enough to cause pain or drop a star. Also, they didn’t give as much wet rock traction as I’d hoped, but again, hard to take off for it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sekula

customer_reviews.title: Good for its intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear with socks as an upgrade from sandals. They are not intended to be used in sandy areas as the sand will collect in all the shoes crevasses. Long walks will result in blisters if not paired with socks. Unfortunately I returned these after walking many miles in them because the sole had a painful lump in the right shoe. Maybe these could be 5 stars but again...socks are needed for long walks and without socks they feel very clammy. I might purchase these again but in a Merrill store so I can feel the product for defects.
customer_reviews.author: Lost in PA

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Teva water shoes for about 10 years. They were really well built , heavy duty and I could walk in them wet, dry, on land and in the river. When they finally gave out I tried several shoes and they all had major issues (lots of blisters when you try to walk in them when they are wet). These Blaze shoes have turned out to be a great replacement for my old Teva's. They are a lot lighter but well made and I can transition from creek/river to trail without worry.
customer_reviews.author: Mavrik02

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had a slightly different pair of these that I wore for years. The biggest difference for me is not having an adjustable back strap. The back strap is loose but the rest of the shoe fits fine. I can try to use the elastic to get it tight all over, but that to try to shore up the back just makes the extra elastic band ridiculously long and event tucking it under the cross straps still leaves several inches past the toe. For the price I expected better. I loved my old ones, but will likely look to a different brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Marshall

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Hiking Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I own multiple pairs of this shoe and have hiked all over the country and world through various terrain. I have an extra wide foot, so I do have to break these in before they're really comfortable. I don't wear socks and only use a pair of carbon Odor Eaters inserts. When they're new my little toes would catch in one of the cutouts and cause a blister, but a Bandaid solves that. Even better are silicone toe protectors, which I switched to and use all the time. I've hiked over 60 miles this past week and the shoes are still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Radovan Milovan

customer_reviews.title: Funky size, poor stitching
customer_reviews.text: Took me 3 orders to finally get a pair of these shoes, and then the stitching started coming undone on my first time out with them. Less than a mile walked. First pair was a size 11, which I normally wear. Length felt correct but the toe-box was very roomy, like it was too tall. So I exchanged them for a size 10.5 which felt too short by had an appropriate sized toe-box. Returned the 10.5 in favor of 11's again and the threads started unraveling on my first walk around the house and in the garden (not even on a hike or anything like that).
customer_reviews.author: Cobus

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sandal!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a Merrell fan for years but this is the first sandal I’ve owned. I really like these, in fact, I ordered a second pair. Their construction and materials are high quality and the fit is true to size. They are very light weight but also provide protection. The footbed is comfortable. One thing though, they don’t provide significant support at the arch or around the foot if you intend to wear them for a lot of walking. Keens do a better job with stability and support. But these Merrell’s are great for what they are. They are not clunky at all and are nice looking. That’s why I have two pair.
customer_reviews.author: HiHoSteveO

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried these shoes on when received & they looked good & felt great!!! I broke in another pair of shoes & just now the Merrells. Day # 1, I'm outside in the sunlight, look down, and I'm aghast, to my utter surprise the color of the shoes is predominately OLIVE GREEN!!! They look tan & brown inside and on AMAZON'S Photos which is the color I wanted. So no matter how comfortable or high quality these shoes they will ABSOLUTELY POSITIVELY NOT BE WORN BY ME!!! Because I wore these for one day & return is unlikely, credit as well. time to throw out. Merrell & Amazon this was deceptive!!! Waste of my money!!! I'm really disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Garvey

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but not a sole mate
customer_reviews.text: Merrill foot ware have always been excellent and fairly expensive . My only criticism is that it does not take much more than a year for the sole to separate. This is true of most of the athletic type of shoes I have bought . Shoe Goo adhesive is a waste of money and time under these curcumstances. I would like to find an athletic type shoe that will last sole wise for a longer period of time... As it is, I only use these types of shoes for 3 to 4 mos a year . Not good that the soles separate so soon. Great shoes. --- just need a true sole ( soul) Excellent fit / comfort/ color
customer_reviews.author: CBBMD

customer_reviews.title: Straps Break
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a KEEN sandal guy for around 15 years. It seemed like the newer versions of the KEENs didn’t fit my foot well anymore for some reason. I decided to try these. They fit great and are very comfortable. I think they are lighter than a comparable KEEN as well. I recommend these sandals. Edit: After 6 weeks of easy use one of the straps/eyelets broke. The strap material doesn't seem up to the task
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Get some tevas
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these for a couple of months now and they have caused me terrible arch pain. The arch support in them is very minimal and has caused planter fasciitis to the point I had to stop wearing them. I love merrell hiking shoes but these are junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brian and Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Comfortable and Fit Correctly
customer_reviews.text: Amazon delivered these sandals a day early, which I appreciate. I wear size 11 sandals, ordered size 11 , received size 11, and they fit perfectly. The toe box is wide enough so that your feet aren't cramped. Well built. Ordered these to replace a pair of Keen Newport H2 water sandals which came apart after 3 months. Merrells are known for durability. These look like they will last longer. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made.  Haven't fallen apart after a fair bit of use.
customer_reviews.text: I've taken these on hikes (dry and wet), canoeing, kayaking, snorkeling in cenotes, and tried them on a beach as well. They're perfect for situations where you'll be getting very wet, and have to keep your feet protected. However, they did do a number on my feet after walking over a mile or so. They do hold a fair amount of sand in them, so use on the beach isn't recommended. They're easy to clean, fairly tough, and the soles were grippy enough for everything I did.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable forget about flips flops or other sandals worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These bad boys are awesome so much better then wearing sandals very comfortable i walked alot on my vacation and wore them everywhere my feet did not hurt or ache during or after long walking days the only thing that I can say that's sort of negative is I feel they dont match well with alot of clothes I wear so i dress around it or dont really care at times lol
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at Zion Narrows
customer_reviews.text: We hiked the Zion Narrows in these. Miles through waist-deep water, slippery rocks, and plenty on dry trails. They held up very well. I didn’t get many rocks in them - if I did, they were small and could be shaken out. They were nearly perfect for that type of use, except for the fact that I started to develop some painful blistering on the insides on both feet towards the end. I’d recommend wearing socks with them if your feet aren’t that calloused.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for some water sandals that had lived out their useful life after 20 years of use. I could not be happier with these. I spent two weeks touring in Thailand including the Songkran New Years/Water Festival and they were great. Did not slip on hard wet surfaces, no chafing or sore spots on my feet at all. Fit snug and secure without my feet slipping in the sandal. Wet or dry they performed great. I wore them both barefoot and with low cut athletic socks and had a good fit both ways.
customer_reviews.author: R Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for muddy trails and rocky beaches
customer_reviews.text: My husband wore these for two weeks straight on an island vacation. I got the women's version. They were AMAZING. We could hike on the super muddy trails and sink right in and then blast off all the mud with water before getting in the car again. Also wore them in the ocean on particularly rocky beaches. They weren't super comfortable while walking around with them wet but they dry pretty quick and they were so much more versatile than regular hiking shoes. The arch support was good and we never had tired feet.
customer_reviews.author: RZ

customer_reviews.title: Hiking sandals
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size 11 because I wear a 10 1/2. The 11 was to big, so I sent them back. I ordered size 10 and they fit perfectly. I bought them to go on a cruise to use when I'm off the ship. Haven't tried them yet, but if they are anything like the merrell sneakers and boots I have owned in the past I'll be in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Doug K.

customer_reviews.title: Buy them a little smaller than a normal shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Whatever shoe size you normally wear, drop it by either a half or one size as you won’t be wearing socks with these. It’s not water resistant, as it’s designed for use in water. . I wore these for about ten hours straight, walking, driving, on the beach, in a boat, etc, Without a problem, and they were the only shoes I wore on my trip. A little expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: mysurgeonforbeauty

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip to Costa Rica and since then have taken them on adventures all over the place. From scaling rocks and jumping into the ocean to hiking into remote locations and jumping into rivers. These are some awesome water shoes and I love the fact they have Vibram nonslip soles. I read some reviews of people complaining that stuff such as rocks or sand get inside then when you get in the water, of course stuff does they have holes in them. Rinse them out and keep on going.
customer_reviews.author: Jpnff

customer_reviews.title: Another great All Out Blaze shoe
customer_reviews.text: These original All Out Blaze shoes (not the Blaze 2 edition) have a consistent last that really fits my feet, so I have collected several. They all walk incredibly well (minimal 4 mm rise in the heel, so they give you good control and toe off for walking/hiking/water sports. I’m so glad they are still available. The newer Blaze 2 line isn’t nearly as varied or useful, in my opinion. These Sieve shoes offer sandal coolness/ventilation with protection for the top of your toes and real shoe-like support with a unified/shock-cord lacing system.
customer_reviews.author: A. Matheny

customer_reviews.title: Great Fishing Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I use these for fishing on rainy days. I really like the comfort and fit. I have a very high instep, so these take a bit of work to put them on. Only reason for not giving 5 stars is that there should have been a pull tab on top the heel strap. My old Keens's had that tab, that I miss on this one. But, the fit is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Great after first stream/waterfall hike
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out on my first stream/waterfall hike this past weekend. Fit was perfect, the neoprene lining added the comfort and stretched my foot for a snug fit. They also grip just about as well as my other hiking shoes. Though I guess the way I walk, I do get the occasional pebble stuck under my foot and didn't remove in time and caused a blister. I would suggest maybe using a thing sock to protect your feet or just remove whatever gets stuck immediately. I will follow up in a few months for an updated review.
customer_reviews.author: Jer Da Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love them. They survived (and are still going strong) an entire year of extreme creek trekking every weekend going miles upstream on Georgia mountain creeks. Climbed multiple 3000ft mountains. Wore them entirely with no socks and I never once got a blister. The only complaint I have for them is since they are open, gravel and other debris can easily get in and It can be a pain to get stuff out.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These run big I was worried weather these would be wide enough because I Wear a EE. but no problem plenty wide and toe space was ample. Slippery on tile floors when wet. Not good for sand due to open design. I bought these to use in water at ocean but never did because of the sand issue. I do wear these on weekends and out shopping with no show socks. Very comfortable. I'm happy with these even though could not use as I intended to
customer_reviews.author: Radiantking

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Customer
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing my husband likes more than finding something he loves and then buying it over and over (and over!) again. He finds these sandals very comfortable and wears them year-round. To him, they offer the support of a tennis shoe while allowing for great venting in the heat of Southern California. God willing, I'll keep buying them as long as Merrell offers them. The previous pair is about 2 years old with constant wear. I'd say that's a pretty well-made product. RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: DeeTee

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The first pair survived two (!!!) ascends to Kilimanjaro mountain (first days when it was still hot). The shoes feel very nice on feet, not too tight, not too wobbly. The build quality is exceptional, the holes ventilate the feet well. I love the fact that they cover toes: not only this looks much better than open toes design but also provides added protection to my feet. I can't be happier with these and the fact that I'm buying second pair after the first one wore out in 4 seasons speaks volumes.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it if your feet sweat, they'll peel off, totally unpleasant
customer_reviews.text: I bought them because my feet sweat a lot during summer and thought of giving this sandals a chance. Turns out they're not the right product for me. After about an hour of use, the sweat of my feet combined with the friction somehow accelerates the wearing of the interior and starts to peel it off giving a grainy and slippery sensation that's obviously unpleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: One with the foot
customer_reviews.text: This is my husbands second pair becsuse he likes them do much. One for work, one for play. The people at Merrill are truely one with the foot. They know how to design a shoe to conform to the foot. My husband says he no longer has foot pain. Also, note the sizing is true to size. I ordered half size larger as most of his other shoes needed to be, but not Merrills. I returned and got his true size. Update Nov 2018. A yr later the material holding the laces is ripping apart. Ver poor quality materials. So disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Arch support and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I finally used these shoes during a cruise and can give my two cents. The shoes are comfortable. They provide decent arch support which I have issues with. Never felt pain, but the only issue I had was the sand. As soon as I got in the water, the rocks and sand got in the shoe right away. It was very uncomfortable and was hard to get the rocks out. If these were advertised as water (swimming pool only) shoes, then I can give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: I figured between having slightly narrower feet and a bunion these wouldn't be comfortable. I. Was. Wrong. Easily the most comfy sandals/water shoes I've owned and I don't have a lick of foot fatigue or sore "wear" areas after a full-day's use. Easy on, easy off. They'll get a big-time water test on the Road to Hana soon enough. For now, they're just everyday around-town wear but they've exceeded my expectations there.
customer_reviews.author: JRausta

customer_reviews.title: Best water shoe I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these, so I can't say how long they will last, but they are amazing. I spent last weekend using them as my primary hiking shoes while hiking all over the Sierras outside of Shaver Lake Ca. They did well in water, on the trail, and off the trail. Yes, the occasional rock and some sand gets in there but it is nothing that can't be taken care of quickly. I have a pair of Merrell boots that have lasted me ten years, I hope these have a similar life span.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hossli

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love em...not much to say. They are awesome. Update...We just hiked the Narrows in Zion National Park. Both my wife and I had these bad boys on. Oh, they rocked. They were stable, they didn't slip on the rocks, and the water drained from them unbelievably fast. We paired them with wetsuit bottoms and wetsuit socks. We were very comfortable in 50-60 degree water. Love these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: DuneJeep

customer_reviews.title: Quite possibly the greatest shoes I have
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for a music festival and I’m not lying when I say I’ve barely taken them off since. I find them very comfortable and supportive, even with my flat feet. I typically need wide shoes, but these fit really well and don’t become distorted by my thick feet. The materials are holding up really well and the bottoms have barely begun to wear out despite walking many thousands of steps over the past few months. They dry quickly and the ability to walk through just about every terrain, including streams and rivers, is empowering. I’ll be sad when I have to hang them up for winter. Great for any urban/rural hiker. Chicks dig em too ;)
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Guralsky

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly tough and comfotable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes a year and half. They have lived through harsh conditions and performed well. I use them to walk my dogs. Truly amphibious. The trails I prefer flood often. In the summer they get wet daily but these shoes dry quickly. Usually ready to go in 24 hours. Very comfortable and easy to get on and off. Will buy again. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Heraldo

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a hike with multiple waist deep water crossings. I was hesitant to wear them without socks but I went with it since I’ve got multiple pairs of Merrells and love them. Long story short, these things are great. Just make sure they don’t get grit in them that can rub a blister. They’re even more comfortable than I expected and seem to be built to take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus Decimus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for boating especially when launching and retrieving your boat....
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for boating! I bought these to help load and unload our boat and they work perfect for that. They seem to be very slip resistant when climbing around on our boat trailer as well as on the boat ramp. I will never wear flip-flops again when prepping our boat for launch. They seem to dry super fast and your foot holds well in the shoe even when wet. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Well made and comfortable...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoes, which I expected from Merrell. I wanted some I could use on a cruise as well as trekking through port stops. Appears to be well made in fact when I ordered them I didn't realize they are same color and design as some Keen hiking shoes I wear daily. These may become my daily shoes during the summer months. Very comfortable, light and cool (temp). Size was exact to my regular shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: R.Hector Campos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Choice for the Expedition of a Lifetime
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trip to the Galapagos. We were visiting each island via Zodiac and some landings were going to be wet. These Merrells held up perfectly, not only for the landings but the hikes that followed. They fit very well (as do all Merrell products I have purchased) and are stretchy, so I can throw them on easily any time for (boring) New England errands.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Crafts

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, solid water shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the best water shoe I've ever owned. In fact, I purchased a pair more than a year ago, and have purchased a second pair...not because the first pair wore out, but to keep in the car in case I forget to bring/wear the first pair with me. After wearing the water shoe for thousands of boating miles, and hundreds of walking miles, it has little or no wear. Fantastic shoe!!
customer_reviews.author: Samwell

customer_reviews.title: One small designs flaw.
customer_reviews.text: The soles have lasted so far with no sign of separation, but the lace loops need improvement. They still hold onto my feet enough, but I feel they’ll only last another few months. Not the long term durability that I’ve known from Merrell. If those loops were reinforced these would be absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I work on a boat and I wear these for 15+ hours a day. My feet hurt by the end of the day but that probably has more to do with the length of time. They dry quickly and have a good amount of grip even on slick rock. I’ve still slid on algae covered rocks but I don’t think anything would work on those. They have a ton of grip on dry rocks. I would recommend as a water shoe.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Merrell used to make good shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and buy that other pair you are looking at. These things looked cheaply built coming out of the box and then proceeded to fall apart the first time I wore them. Will never buy another pair of Merrell shoes again. There are plenty of better brands out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More of a sandal.
customer_reviews.text: This more of a sandal than anything else, in the shoreline, expect it to load up with sand, debris, etc.. Even hiking on a firm dirt path, the shoe will find the odd pebble and kick it into the heel area and you won't be able to shake it out, you'll have to stop to remove it. The tread and materials are Merrel quality.
customer_reviews.author: Manfish

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and value and a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a pair of these shoes for quite some time, they are very comfortable, practical and last a long time. I use them for my duties around the yard and they serve me well. It was time to replace them, the new pair is as great as the ones I’ve replaced them with. Very satisfied with my purchase and this seller.
customer_reviews.author: MGT5000

customer_reviews.title: Great product all around!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic summer shoes! I'll be using mine for light hiking, beach and pool activities. I usually wear them without socks and they are amazingly comfortable! And when I want more of a "dressed up" look, I put on some black low cut socks. They look, feel, and perform fantastic either way. I highly recommend these shoes! And Amazon rocks with ease of ordering and their quick delivery systems.👍💙
customer_reviews.author: Richard B. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Have no fear , Wide feet accepted
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet (EE) size 12 and was hesitant on purchasing these shoes. I like the outdoors and when it comes to shoes its slim picking for me . I bought them 12 regular width for mainly kayaking, river, beach exposure. But when they arrived I tried them on and they feel perfect, so I think they do run a little wide but great for me , even with socks
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Super uncomfortable. Makes indents into your feet and causes blisters. Wish I didn’t spend so much on this shoe. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and extremely durable!
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply the most comfortable and durable sandle I have ever owned. My first pair is 4 yrs old, I wear them every day for all sorts of extreme outdoor activities. Except for fading from the sun, they are still in basically perfect condition. I recently ordered another pair to have, just in case Merrel would change or discontinue this specific style/model. I also look forward to trying more of their shoes in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Versatile
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend and I bought these shoes a few months ago to use in the Narrows at Zion NP and we were not disappointed. These had very good grip on the slippery rocks and made our 9.5 mile river walk a great experience. I paired these with a pair of neoprene socks and my feet were warm and comfortable the whole day. Since then I have used these on many hikes where water is expected and I cannot recommend them enough. Expect about a 2-day dry time in colder temps. Here in so-cal about one day to dry. I like strapping these onto the roof of my car to hasten the dry time as I drive back home/to camp, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Hard on my feet and maybe defective
customer_reviews.text: There is very little flexible cushion on the sole which makes them not good for general walking around. The pair I have has a left foot that feels like there is a small rock in the tread. It's caused a bone in my foot to get out of wack and now my foot still hurts a week after not wearing them. I've never had an issue with Merrell's comfort nor quality control until now.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, comfortable but lacking in arch support.
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of Keen Newport H2's that lasted years. Eventually the soles wore out. Wanted to try something new and these looked great and the price was a bit more affordable. Have only had for a short while and so far so good though 1) they do not feel as secure as the keen. When hiking in wet areas I fear that my foot will slip inside the shoe more so then the keen's did... though admittedly I've not yet used them in this environment. 2) they have zero arch support. I have flat feet and suspect that this might be problematic for a long hike. Otherwise I like the style and comfort very much.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie H

customer_reviews.title: They seem very comfortable so far but they do run a little large
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these to use this next coming week. They seem very comfortable so far but they do run a little large. I originally bought a pair of 11.5's as the Merrell hiking boots I use are 11.5 and that's the size I usually wear in other brands but that was too big with these. I ended up returning them and exchanging them for a pair of 11's which fit great. The width is very good, I usually wear wide New Balances and these don't squeeze my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I especially like this pair of Merrells!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I badly needed a pair of Water Shoes for an Expedition Cruise with wet ocean landings and hadn't prepared myself. Flip-flops worked but were a bit dangerous. I asked several cruise-mates about their Keens and others, but the Merrells seemed to be the winner. They fit well... are loose enough for wiggle room. I am breaking them in for my next Expedition by hiking a bit around the desert. Okay, not the best test for a water shoe, but I will definitely see if they are rugged enough. I will update this review, only if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Punk

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my brother in law who is a fisherman. He is difficult to order shoes for since he wears a size 16. And wide. I was worried that they wouldn’t fit but they fit perfectly!!!! He loves them and wears them for washing the car, or things outside. I’m so happy that they were a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Diana H.

customer_reviews.title: comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift for a relative. Both my husband and I own several pairs of the all out blaze water shoe. The soles are still in very good condition after 4 years or more. Insoles are soft but give support and they are lightweight and cool to wear. True to size. Highly recommended by all of us.
customer_reviews.author: pigtail

customer_reviews.title: Expensive But worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I won't usually pay this kind of $$ for shoes But I'm planning a trip next week that involves walking up the Narrows in Zion and the water walkers looked to be the best of the bunch. All I've done is was Tham around the house so far butthye are soft, stretchy and comfortable. Lightweight too. they MAY be the best hiking shoe I've had. So far I think it was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Walker

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes they dry fast and I wear them ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes they dry fast and I wear them everywhere. Also because of the large opening in the back the sand runs right out with just a little bit of water, I no longer have to take my shoes off just because of a small amount of sand
customer_reviews.author: King Bondo

customer_reviews.title: Love. Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: Love. Very comfy. Easy on. Easy off. Great for around the house. Not as great running on trails bc I feel right through them. Decent 4 star tread grip tho. I wear these every day. They are my default shoes for now as I hate wasting time on laces or the weird draw string is not too long to get in the way like others have. Usually the elastic is all that's needed. No adjusting. I've had Merrell boots also that have been great. I have wide feet & need arch support. Merrell's are good for that. The sandals have moderate arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica🌸

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit wearing these much more than I expected I would. They are super comfy for general light-duty hiking or even wearing around the house. Comfortable in the water too unless the occasional pebble finds it way into the shoe. Seem to be wearing well considering how much I actually wear these. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Great all around.
customer_reviews.text: The fit is great, and they are very comfortable. I wore these while hiking in Bradford Woods (Martinsvilme, IN) for about 5 days. I was on my feet for around 12 hours each day, and these felt great. I also wore these while swimming in the lake there. If lake or river swimming, my only advice would be to make sure they are laced tight. The suction of the mud can pull them off if work loose.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Pleased by fit
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many pairs of merrell shoes over the years, but have required a wide for comfort. Unfortunately, this leaves me with limited options. I took a chance with these sandals, hoping they would be looser in the toe area than a regular shoe. Very pleased to find out this was the case.
customer_reviews.author: SJW

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality shoe
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. These are well built shoes with good attention to detail. The lace tie works well and holds even under heavy use. Comfort level is very high and they seem like they will last awhile. We'll see.......I can see why Merrell is considered a top brand.
customer_reviews.author: mif962

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a long time to try out these shoes but very happy to this point. They are a very comfortable shoe. I have a wide foot and they fit very nicely. Based on prior reviews a bought a 1/2 size smaller and they are perfect. The look very nice as well. I have been wearing them with a no show sock and they are comfortable with no sweating and you would not know I had a sock on. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality stitching. Coming off after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could return the shoes. I didn't even hike or anything. Regular everyday use going to work, shopping etc. The stitching is coming off in several places. Didn't expect this after 2 months from shoes that cost 90 dollars. Fit: A little bit wide towards the front, otherwise the fit is great.
customer_reviews.author: Tonmoy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the shoes and it is my second pair. These are excellent for the hot weather (arizona) and for hiking around creeks and rivers. Have always been a fan of the Vibram soles since they always live up to their reputation. This is my every day kick around shoe and what I use for mountain biking. I have yet to find something better.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Reedy

customer_reviews.title: My Merrells Didn't Last
customer_reviews.text: I like most Merrell Shoes. Bought these from Peltz Shoes for $80 on Amazon in Apr 2019; by Jul 2019 the shoestring eyelets began tearing apart on their own accord and no longer functional. Neither Amazon nor Peltz nor Merrell will replace them, so my purchase was a waste of money and a waste of a pair of otherwise good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN SEXTON

customer_reviews.title: My left foot is a good 1/2 size bigger than my right
customer_reviews.text: I can't complain because I knew I take a wide size. I take a 12.5E. My left foot is a good 1/2 size bigger than my right. I bought the 12.5 size and it rubs a little on the instep of my left foot. The shoe doesn't have great traction on slippery surfaces. So probably not a good shoe for river fishing on slippery rocks. All that being said I wear them all the time at home and quick trips out. They slip on very easily and fit snug without feeling too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth C. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, dries quickly, perfect for hiking and creeks
customer_reviews.text: Husband ranges between size 11&12 . Other reviews said these run a bit big so he went with the 11. It was a perfect fit. Shoe feels comfortable and is perfect for hiking and crossing/playing in a rocky creek.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Bauder

customer_reviews.title: Love them favorite shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. Wear them with black socks no one can tell theres holes in them and my feet rarely sweat all day. I dont care when I walk in puddles and you can walk on a wet surface with socks and still dont really get wet the toe is slightly covered which is good for protection.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOE!
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE HAD A VERY HARD TIME FINDING SHOES WIDE ENOUGH AND COMFORTABLE TO WEAR ALL DAY. THEN I FOUND MERRILL SHOES. I ALWAYS ORDER MENS.THESE FIT GREAT . I'M A PRESCHOOL TEACHER AND ON MY FEET ALOT.I AM OLDER NOW AND NO LONGER CAN GO HIKING. BUT STILL WEAR THESE EVERYDAY .I ALSO HAVE DIABETES AND FOOT PROBLEMS, AND THESE HELP PROTECT MY FEET.
customer_reviews.author: shadow

customer_reviews.title: Merrell all out blaze sieve
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these sandals! I ordered these twice and both times the rear strap started to break! I personally did not get blisters. I gently broke both the pairs in by going on a walk around town (2-3 miles each time) . By the second and third use the rear left strap started breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I've been wanting
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a pair of these shoes for a long time. Great to clean, good traction while in creeks or on rocks. Very easy to clean out if sand, mudd or water get in them. Still able to run if need be, fit very comfortably, easy to put on and take off. Also, they look great in person, definitely will buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Positive - revised review
customer_reviews.text: After casual and in water wearing this shoe, I am revising my review from 4 to 5 stars. I was concerned with 'arch support' but must state that is 'not an issue'. These are comfortable, light weight shoes, with a flat sole that grips on wet surface; quality and finish is 'very good'. I highly recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ron H Fovargue

customer_reviews.title: You can get them on & off in very little time!  My feet are happy!
customer_reviews.text: These water shoes are the real deal. I bought them in place of sandals. Incredibly easy & quick to remove, with just a finger or two. Despite the toe protection, these shoes offer great breathability. Only downside, there is no arch support or padding on the soles. But don’t let that deter you. You will be very pleased with your purchase. Thanks Merrell!
customer_reviews.author: James Samas

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these a week and I usually wait to do reviews but even though it is my 1st pair of Merrell sandsls it is my 4th Merrell product. The size is spot on what I wear withother shoes. These are even more comfortable than I imagined. Because of my past experience with Merrell I expect these to last quite a while. They look judt like the picture.
customer_reviews.author: AZ golfer

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe these fit my wide feet!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for water shoes to fit my really wide feet and I've wasted plenty of money on shoes that are too narrow (and sometimes a bit too lazy to return to Amazon....) I was at Cabela's recently and gave these a shot. To my surprise, they fit great! Much better than the similar KEEN water shoes. I haven't worn them in the water yet but they appear to be well built and fit my feet great.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these almost every day for 3 months and find the quite comfortable. I tried many other brands and my little toe sticks out the hole on other shoes and gets blisters and scratches.
customer_reviews.author: havaiisteve

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Keen sandles
customer_reviews.text: Found these discounted on Amazon and took a chance they would fit. Glad I did. Great fit. And a Vibram sole. Looking forward to trying this out on the rivers and lakes in colorado this summer canoeing and rafting.
customer_reviews.author: NikonFotoMatt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wet hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome shoes. I purchased these for our Hawaiian adventure vacation and they worked like a champ! Did a 10 mile waterfall hike in Kauai, in the pouring rain, thru several running water and river crossings, over rocks, thru tight paths close to the edge. I slipped only a handful of times, nothing to do with the shoes. Had I worn full up hiking shoes/boots, which I own several, I would have been miserable as they would have been filled with water after 2 miles. They are still sandels so you will get rocks and mud stuck in them, nothing a quick rinse can’t fix.
customer_reviews.author: gmoff22

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for my Keen’s
customer_reviews.text: Last couple pairs of Keen’s that I have had, the stitching would loosen. So I found these Marrell‘s, and they are a great replacement and a great fit I haven’t worn them to the beach yet but I love them and they feel great walking through the woods., Easy to slip them very comfy too.
customer_reviews.author: Jacksdaddy from  N.C

customer_reviews.title: Liked them better than Keen H2
customer_reviews.text: Tried on both these and the Keen H2 and thought these were much more comfortable, especially the heel strap. But all around much more comfy. Had them 2 months and I love them. Fit as expected and consistent with other stuff from merrel
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very good fit and looks.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for me. I had it’s older version from 2016 but this one fits even better. The front width is truer and the over all support seems to be better than the previous model. It’s lightweight and very - repeat very - durable based on my experience with the previous model.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fishing shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband to use during a fishing tournament. He was able to use immediately, no break in needed. Wore them several hours each day. Mostly standing. Dried quickly. He said they felt better than a tennis shoe. No low back pain at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: SUPER Comfortable!  Highly Recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these shoes for a trip to Maui. Wore them practically the entire six days we were there and my feet couldn't be happier. Great for hiking, snorkeling, and walking along the beach. I even wore them in the city just like I would a regular pair of tennis/running shoes. They are super comfortable and great for those of you who have wide feet like me. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: All-around great sandals, though a bit small and needs bigger loop in back
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Lightweight (much lighter than Keen) - Easy to put on (despite ridiculously small loop in the back) - Comfortable against skin - Good toe protection Cons: - A bit small compared to other sandals I've gotten in this size. - Loop in the back is a joke - Pricey - Although not as rock-hard as Keens, they're not quite as cushy as sneakers
customer_reviews.author: HecsBox

customer_reviews.title: Heel strap falls off!!!
customer_reviews.text: The heel straps fall off and must be pulled up every 20 feet!! HORRIBLE if want to wear socks, but even bare foot the heel straps drop down off foot!!! But they know this defect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave-Medic#1

customer_reviews.title: Far to Big
customer_reviews.text: I wear an 11.5 and I was suggested by either Amazon or Merrell that 11.5 is what I needed to order. They ended up being way to big and I had to send them back and get a smaller size. This will be the only 11 size show I own. On a positive note they looked and felt great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bond

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for every day or outdoors
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is well designed with quality materials, including pull strap that tucks away. I wear them all the time — with dark low socks in town or barefoot outside hiking. Just wish the soles had a bit more cushion. Still, it is the best shoe in its category.
customer_reviews.author: DavidtheTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’m currently on vacation in Costa Rica and bought these for a lot of the outdoor adventures we’d be going on. They are awesome - plain and simple. I usually have issues with new shoes (blisters, etc) and haven’t had any issues with these. I’ve been in them for 12 to 15 hours at a time, in the water, hiking, and walking in town. I highly recommend them. My wife got the female version and says the same about them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Potter

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, and Merrell Reliability
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, durable, comfortable, my go to Daily Wear in the warmer months! Good support, good looks, and great airflow to keep my feet dry. Merrell is one of the best for a good reason. We get solid performance and comfort every time I buy a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Perry E.

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a fishing trip. Thought I might wear them occasionally. I wear them every day. Great summer shoes. Wear them to the pool to the grocery store literally everywear. Comfortable and cool. I believe they will hold up well. Will update if not.
customer_reviews.author: jeff kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Another winner from Merrell
customer_reviews.text: The Merrells replaced another from the same company and did it with sophistication. The biggest difference is that the old ones had a Velcro strap around the back and these have an elastic one. No problem. They fit well, have a good sole that makes walking easy anywhere, and a light-weight and nicely ventilated. I had tried a pair of Tevas as the initial replacement but they didn't work at all. It is good to stick with a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Karlovits

customer_reviews.title: Finally after many attempts at Keens
customer_reviews.text: I have a really comfortable pair of similar sandals from LLBean that after many years finally started to fall apart - but LLB no longer makes them. So the search began for a replacement. I tried 3 Keens (CNX, Owyhee and Newport) and all had issues. So I moved onto this Merrells - these rock! Light weight, comfortable and I like leather construction.
customer_reviews.author: PaulD

customer_reviews.title: Great traction and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I took these on a fishing trip to Canada. They were just what I needed for wet feet. Water drained out and I didn’t feel like I was sloshing around. The traction on these is fantastic. Climbing over rocks and hiking through the wilderness in pouring rain was a breeze. These are my new go-to outdoor shoe when water is anywhere near.
customer_reviews.author: John Blancuzzi

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit & Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have not worn these on a hike as of yet, but I have walked around my neighborhood with these & they performed very well. The fit is spot on (Size 10.5 -Medium Width foot) & the shoe is very well constructed. The easy lace system is also a nice touch. Cant wait to use these hiking in Yosemite this May. Well Done Merrill.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best sandals I've ever owned. Needs to be broken in a day before like the comments suggest, but once past that they feel great for hikes (both dry and wet), light walks and everyday use. One thing worth mentioning is that even if these do get wet, they dry off very quickly and leave no smell after. Would buy them again :)
customer_reviews.author: Ankit

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and light
customer_reviews.text: This product is used in place of slippers around the house. My son's slippers and slides give no shape and support to his foot. I noticed his foot turning as he walked around the house. I purchased this for him to wear in casual situations but also around the house but most importantly to supply and arch and support to a fifteen years old's foot.
customer_reviews.author: vincent tarsi

customer_reviews.title: Great but check for stitching defects
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned a pair of these for years and they have been great. They finally started showing wear so I ordered a new pair for me and one for my son. On both new pairs, and the replacements, the stitching came apart in multiple places, especially the heal immediately. Hopefully Merrill can up the quality control as I’d still like a new pair without the defects!
customer_reviews.author: Kent Gavin

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's All Out Blaze Sieve Water Shoes
product_meta.description: When adventure leads you over land and through steams, be ready by gearing up in the Merrell® All Out Blaze Sieve water-ready hiking sandal. Waxy, waterproof leather and stretch Lycra® neoprene upper materials. Bungee lacing system allows for quick-and-easy adjustments on the go. Protective toe bumper. M Select® FRESH antimicrobial treatment helps keep odors under control. Unlined footbed. UniFly® midsole provides all-day cushioned comfort. TC5+Vibram® outsole with 3 mm lugs delivers reliable traction. Imported. Measurements: Weight: 10.9 oz Product measurements were taken using size 7, width M. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
